intro: Asperula cynanchica var. alpina, commonly known as the Alpine asperula, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Asperula cynanchica var. alpina is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
